name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings
— all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP,CSEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS, Hume Council Permit No: P25490
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP, CSEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS, Permit No: P25490
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A  qualified ecologist and/or  botanist  has examined trees to be removed and/or any fallen logs affected by works and provided written clearance for removal; has provided advice on alternative fauna habitat sites if applicable and be present on the site during any relocation works if required.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Obtain Part 13 Permit & PP010l permit from APAM prior to tree removal. Obtain all other permits and/or approvals to disturb flora/fauna sites. Ensure that a copy of these permits are obtained prior to the commencement of tree removal works.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Insert lot start date:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The work area has been determined, and the extent of clear and grub has been reviewed by Fulton Hogan and the Superintendent. Any trees to be removed have been clearly marked and confirmed on site.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Existing vegetation and native fauna habitat identified in the Contract to be retained, shall be identified as ‘No-Go Zones’ and protected by temporary fencing, consisting of, as a minimum, star pickets,wire support and parawebbing.  Signage shall be erected outside the limit of the of the vegetation or the habitat site.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.4 Clear felling distances of trees are adequate.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the clear distances are adequate and signage is inplace as planned. Trees shall be brought down in such manner as to avoid danger to personnel and traffic or damage to other trees, shrubs, structures or property outside the area being cleared or designated to be retained within the area being cleared.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.5 Clear and grub trees and vegetation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Vegetation in areas of site excavation have been cleared and grubbed to at least 0.3m below subgrade, all other vegetation and obstructions cleared to natural surface level
○ Tree branches extending over the carriageway shall be trimmed to provide minimum clearance of 6m above the carriageway surface.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any holes produced from grubbing operations have been backfilled with similar material to the sorrounding material and compacted to the same degree to the sorrounding material.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Trees that are to be removed shall be mulched to the extent possible and the mulch retained for use in the Landscaping Works or otherwise transported to the APAM mulch laydown area.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.8 Dispose of concrete, bituminous and other recyclable materials.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Salvaged concrete, bituminous materials over 50mm and other  recyclable materials shall be  sent to APAM site recycling facilities.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cold planing shall be carried out in a manner such that a uniform surface is present on a plane parallel with the ultimate finished surface of the pavement
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
RESPONSIBILITY: Fulton Hogan Engineer / Foreman/ subcontractor

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Average depth of pavement to be removed shall be 40mm ensuring that all Wearing Course is removed. After planing, no point on the planed surface shall be positioned more than 15 mm below a 3 m straightedge placed on the planed surface in any direction.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
RESPONSIBILITY: Fulton Hogan Engineer / Foreman/ subcontractor
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any exposed longitudinal edges within the trafficked area shall be ramped down at a slope no steeper than 5 horizontal to 1 vertical.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
RESPONSIBILITY: Fulton Hogan Engineer / Foreman/ subcontractor

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Temporary ramping shall not be steeper than 20 horizontal to 1 vertical for traffic speeds of more than 75 km/h or 10 horizontal to 1 vertical for traffic speeds of 75 km/h or less
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
RESPONSIBILITY: Fulton Hogan Engineer / Foreman/ subcontractor
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Area has been set out in accordance with the drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material at cut floor level to have CBR > 2% as per drawing 12001.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent and the Contractor shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on suitability in accordance with 204.04.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where unsuitable material is encountered, proposed in-situ treatment must be submitted to the superintendent for review.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where groundwater is encountered the contractor shall notify the superintendent and submit proposed action for review.
○ The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
2.7 Trimming and Level conformity (Scale B for NAR)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point. Random level assessments shall not be undertaken in lots not exceeding 4000 m2.
2.8 Trimming and Level conformity (Scale A for Sunbury Rd)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point. Random level assessments shall not be undertaken in lots not exceeding 4000 m2.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proof rolls to be conducted in accordance with Section 173 of the Department of Transports Standard Specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Testing of every lot shall continue until three consecutive lots of like material and work have achieved the specified requirements in the first test. After satisfying this requirement and establishing a compaction procedure to the satisfaction of the Superintendent, the Contractor may seek the Superintendent’s agreement to reduce the frequency of testing of subsequent lots to the minimum requirements specified in Table 204.142
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All Type A Material = minimum compaction 98% MDD
○ Ripped and re-compacted material below Cut Floor Level = minimum compaction 98% MDD.
○ Type B Material placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material = minimum compaction 95% MDD.
○ Type B material 400mm below the top of Type B material and Top 150mm of where fill is to be constructed = minimum compaction 95% MDD.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Records, Lot Register
3.4 Compaction Testing (Scale A for Sunbury Rd)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All Type A Material = minimum compaction 99% MDD
○ Ripped and re-compacted material below Cut Floor Level = minimum compaction 99% MDD.
○ Type B Material placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material = minimum compaction 97% MDD.
○ Type B material 400mm below the top of Type B material and Top 150mm of where fill is to be constructed = minimum compaction 97% MDD.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Records, Lot Register

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any lot which has a surface area less than 500 m2 may be treated as a small area. Acceptance of the lot shall be based on the mean values of 3 individual tests. Minimum Compaction shall be 100% MDD.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Records, Lot Register
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and setout activity. IFC and latest available revision used

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall not commence placing any fill on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Layers placed and spread in uniform compacted layers not thicker than 200mm.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Lot size for testing is to be one day's production or 5,000m2, whichever is lesser.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proof rolls to be conducted in accordance with Section 173 of the Department of Transports Standard Specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

○ Any rocky material present must be uniform throughout the layer
○ Each layer shall be kept generally parallel to the surface of subgrade
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Initial Testing requirements shall satisfy the full requirements as detailed in the specification. Once three consecutive lots have achieved specified requirement, Superintendent can agree to reduce frequency of testing of subsequent lots to the reduced testing frequency specified in Table 204.141. Reduced frequency resets if one lot fails.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Type A material should be compacted to 99% Characteristic Value of Density Ratio (Scale A).

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any lot which has a surface area less than 500 m2 may be treated as a small area. Acceptance of the lot shall be based on the mean values of 3 individual tests. Minimum Compaction shall be 100% SDD.

FREQUENCY: Each lot, unless reduced frequency has been approved
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:  Material is to be graded such that 100% passes through a 75mm sieve, 40-80% passes through 4.75mm and 10-40% passes 0.075

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: CBR: ≥ 6%, Swell: ≤ 1.5% (Verge material less than 1.0%).

RECORD OF CONFORMITY: CBR/Swell Test Records
FREQUENCY: Each lot, unless reduced frequency has been approved
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: PI between 6 and 25, PI x % passing through 0.425 to be less than 1000

RECORD OF CONFORMITY: PI Test Records
FREQUENCY: Each lot, unless reduced frequency has been approved
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:  Permeability of less than 5X10^-9 for capping and verge material
